toc_entry.title: The Best Of Texas
toc_entry.description: We’ve gone from one end of the state to the other to bring you the best-ever list of Texas Bests.

toc_entry.title: Mikey
toc_entry.description: He left his parents’ house in search of a world where things were black and white, where there were heroes and villains. What he found in the slums of Port Arthur was a world that would tolerate people like him-and take advantage of them.

toc_entry.title: The Bluebonnet Snapshot
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Okay, so photos of cute kids in fields of bluebonnets aren’t great art. That’s not the point at all.

toc_entry.title: Ambient Color
toc_entry.description: As these photographs show, in Mexico the strange is commonplace, and the commonplace, strange.

toc_entry.title: Going Back For Seconds
toc_entry.description: Can there be too much of a good thing? Five of Texas’favorite restaurants have duplicated themselves in other cities, and now they’re finding out.

toc_entry.title: Life, Art, And the Wackiest Politician In Texas
toc_entry.description: San Antonio city councilman Bernardo Eureste took a paltry arts budget and built it into a $3 million power base. Then he got mad and tore it all apart.

toc_entry.title: Why Boone Can’t Lose
toc_entry.description: An old hand at Pickens-watching reveals the key to the Amarillo oilman’s corporate-takeover antics.

toc_entry.title: Registered Herefords On the Lbj Ranch
toc_entry.subtitle: Western Art
toc_entry.description: An interpretation of a classic genre.

toc_entry.title: Birth Of A Lobby
toc_entry.subtitle: Politics
toc_entry.description: The computer industry in Texas has a new lobby organized by three lobbyists who were in the right place at the right time-and knew it.

toc_entry.title: Lingering Blues
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: John Hardee and Budd Johnson were two legendary Texas tenors who had their own ways of making peace with the rigors of the jazz life.

toc_entry.title: Where’s the Lamb?
toc_entry.subtitle: Farm and Ranch
toc_entry.description: After extensive taste tests, our reporter concludes that the best lamb is to be found in our own back yard.

toc_entry.title: Zombie Heaven
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Into the Night leaves you in the dark; The Breakfast Club's teenagers are out to lunch; Witness is a solemn eyeful.

toc_entry.title: Contemporary Classic
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: The octogenarian whom many believe to be the greatest living composer pays a long-awaited visit to Texas.

toc_entry.title: Move Over, Nancy Drew
toc_entry.subtitle: Software
toc_entry.description: Now young adventuresses can do more than just read about excitement. A new computer game for girls requires them to use their wits for survival.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to entertainment and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: The Max factor of Dallas; the tacos of Paris; the tales of Urrutia; the Hemingway of Texas; the good word from Houston; the mysteries of the Hueco Tanks.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: If Lubbock gets a riverwalk, can a river be far behind?; previewing the mayors’ races; can Texas consultants make Pan dulce?; the Chronicle kills a story.
